page.title: 06Glenisla School. contd.
page.content: There are seventeen pupils in the school ranging in age from five to twelve. All pupils are taught in one classroom. The average travelling distance from home to school is four miles. The longest distance a child has to travel is ten miles. The majority of pupils travel to school by mini-bus, some come by car and two pupils walk. The transport is provided by the Education Authority. Since most pupils live some distance from school lunch is taken there. Meals are not cooked on the premises but are brought by taxi from a large primary school in Kirriemuir, about thirteen miles away. A few children eat packed lunches. Visiting teachers include art, music and P.E.teachers. Three pupils take lessons from a violin instructor. The local minister comes to school regularly.
